text:
./configure uses layout for Darwin as default, even when no layout is given.
This  is mentioned in INSTALL, but somewhat contradicts the statements that
default Apache layout will be used when no layout is given and the explicit
statement that nothing will be written outside of prefix, and therefore is
surprising.
creator: spam2death@telton.de
sander@temme.net
text:
The INSTALL file for 1.3.x says, on line 220-222:

     config.layout. Except on MacOS(X) configure defaults to the `Apache'
     classical path layout. You can get an overview of the existing layouts
     by using the command:

I read that to say that Apache will build with the 'Apache' layout by default on every platform aside from 
Mac OS X (Darwin). If you want to build on Darwin and not overwrite the Apache installation that came 
from Apple, use --with-layout=Apache on your ./configure invocation.

I agree that it is somewhat confusing to have a default for everything but a single platform (so I'm not 
marking this as 'INVALID'), but Apache 1.3 is so deeply in maintenance mode that I don't think we will 
change the present behaviour. 

The current release of Apache httpd, 2.2.0, will use the 'Apache' layout by default when building on 
Darwin.
